intro: Paullinia fibrigera, commonly known as the Brazilian soursop or the woolly soursop, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish-green fruits. The fruit has a rough, spiny exterior and contains a white, juicy pulp with a sweet and tart flavor. It is often cultivated for its edible fruit and has traditional medicinal uses in some indigenous communities.
